s.text: Time's and Newsweek 's cover stories describe the cloning process, predicting that the technology will be used on humans in seven years ( Time ) or in one to 10 years ( Newsweek ). Neither is terribly keen on the idea, but both agree that human clones would be normal.
Rolling Stone 's cover story traces Stern's history from mediocre rock DJ to king of shock jocks.
The editorial asserts that welfare reform is already a success, since AFDC (Aid to Families With Dependent Children) caseloads are falling everywhere.
The editorial asserts that welfare reform is already a success, since AFDC (Aid to Families With Dependent Children) caseloads are falling everywhere.

An article on the fund-raising scandal suggests that the White House is terrified at the prospect of more Ickes documents, more China revelations, and the possible cooperation of key players like John Huang.

An article on the fund-raising scandal suggests that the White House is terrified at the prospect of more Ickes documents, more China revelations, and the possible cooperation of key players like John Huang.
"The Age Boom" package celebrates life after 65.

A piece argues that rising carbon-dioxide levels are almost certainly causing the weird weather of the 1990s, and that they will cause unimaginable devastation if the world does not slash fossil-fuel consumption soon.
Also, eight elderly celebs talk about how great it is to get old.
